greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Prime factorization of n+1 encoded with the run lengths of binary expansion.
comment: a(2n) = 1 or 2 mod 4 and a(2n+1) = 0 or 3 mod 4 for all n > 1
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: The binary expansion of a(n) begins from the left with as many 1's as is the exponent of the largest prime present in the factorization of n+1 and from then on follows runs of ej+1 zeros and ones alternatively, where ej are the corresponding exponents of the successively lesser primes (0 if that prime does not divide n+1).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 13 2002
